data.name: Surskit
data.flavorText: It secretes a thick, sweet-scented syrup from the tip of its head. It lives on weed-choked ponds.

data.name: Masquerain
data.flavorText: The antennae have distinctive patterns that look like eyes. When it rains, they grow heavy, making flight impossible.

data.name: Pansage
data.flavorText: It's good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It's kind enough to share them with friends.

data.name: Simisage
data.flavorText: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

data.name: Dwebble
data.flavorText: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.

data.name: Crustle
data.flavorText: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They're mighty enough to crack Rhyperior's carapace.

data.name: Bounsweet
data.flavorText: Its sweat is sweet, like syrup made from boiled- down fruit. Because of this, Bounsweet was highly valued in the past, when sweeteners were scarce.

data.name: Steenee
data.flavorText: Steenee spreads a sweet scent that makes others feel invigorated. This same scent is popular for antiperspirants.

data.name: Blipbug
data.flavorText: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.

data.name: Dottler
data.flavorText: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.

data.name: Orbeetle
data.flavorText: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what's around it—and what's around it can include things over six miles away.

data.name: Nymble
data.flavorText: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it's in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.

data.name: Nymble
data.flavorText: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it's in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.

data.name: Toedscool
data.flavorText: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.

data.name: Toedscool
data.flavorText: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.

data.name: Toedscruel
data.flavorText: It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.

data.name: Wo-Chien
data.flavorText: It drains the life-force from vegetation, causing nearby forests to instantly wither and fields to turn barren.

data.name: Magby
data.flavorText: This Pokémon makes its home near volcanoes. At the end of the day, Magby soaks in magma, resting and recovering from the day's fatigue.

data.name: Pansear
data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Simisear
data.flavorText: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

data.name: Volcanion
data.flavorText: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

data.name: Fuecoco
data.flavorText: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.

data.name: Crocalor
data.flavorText: The combination of Crocalor's fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon's head.

data.name: Charcadet
data.flavorText: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

data.name: Charcadet
data.flavorText: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

data.name: Iron Moth
data.flavorText: No records exist of this species being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon's traits match up with an object described in an old book.

data.name: Chi-Yu
data.flavorText: It controls flames burning at over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.

data.name: Horsea
data.flavorText: They swim with dance-like motions and cause whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.

data.name: Seadra
data.flavorText: Seadra's mouth is slender, but its suction power is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food that's larger than the opening of its mouth.

data.name: Kingdra
data.flavorText: Scales shed by this Pokémon have such a splendorous gleam to them that they've been given to royalty as gifts.

data.name: Remoraid
data.flavorText: Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a Mantine's underside to scavenge for leftovers.

data.name: Octillery
data.flavorText: It traps enemies with its suction-cupped tentacles, then smashes them with its rock-hard head.

data.name: Feebas
data.flavorText: It is a shabby and ugly Pokémon. However, it is very hardy and can survive on little water.

data.name: Milotic
data.flavorText: It's said that a glimpse of a Milotic and its beauty will calm any hostile emotions you're feeling.

data.name: Snorunt
data.flavorText: It is said that several Snorunt gather under giant leaves and live together in harmony.

data.name: Mantyke
data.flavorText: It swims along with a school of Remoraid, and they'll all fight together to repel attackers.

data.name: Palkia
data.flavorText: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

data.name: Panpour
data.flavorText: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

data.name: Simipour
data.flavorText: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

data.name: Vanillite
data.flavorText: Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.

data.name: Vanillish
data.flavorText: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterward—it's a kind Pokémon.

data.name: Vanilluxe
data.flavorText: People believe this Pokémon formed when two Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Wimpod
data.flavorText: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy's presence.

data.name: Wimpod
data.flavorText: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy's presence.

data.name: Golisopod
data.flavorText: They live in sunken ships or in holes in the seabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct battle, the loser becomes the winner's meal.

data.name: Wiglett
data.flavorText: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.

data.name: Wiglett
data.flavorText: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.

data.name: Wugtrio
data.flavorText: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.

data.name: Veluza
data.flavorText: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.

data.name: Dondozo
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it's bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.

data.name: Iron Bundle
data.flavorText: It resembles a mysterious object mentioned in an old book. There are only two reported sightings of this Pokémon.

data.name: Chien-Pao
data.flavorText: The hatred of those who perished by the sword long ago has clad itself in snow and become a Pokémon.

data.name: Elekid
data.flavorText: It's not good at storing electricity yet. This Pokémon sneaks into people's homes, looking for electrical outlets to eat electricity from.

data.name: Plusle
data.flavorText: It absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out its body to create crackling noises.

data.name: Minun
data.flavorText: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

data.name: Blitzle
data.flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

data.name: Zebstrika
data.flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

data.name: Joltik
data.flavorText: Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out static electricity. They're often found sticking to Yamper's hindquarters.

data.name: Galvantula
data.flavorText: It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests of bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are not yet good at flying.

data.name: Zekrom
data.flavorText: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.

data.name: Oricorio
data.flavorText: The energetic, cheerful dance of these Oricorio is popular with children, but the Oricorio themselves are hard to find in Paldea.

data.name: Toxel
data.flavorText: This selfish, attention-seeking Pokémon stores poison and electricity in two different sacs inside its body.

data.name: Natu
data.flavorText: Because its wings aren't yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.

data.name: Xatu
data.flavorText: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun's movement all day.

data.name: Latios
data.flavorText: It understands human speech and is highly intelligent. It is a tender Pokémon that dislikes fighting.

data.name: Deoxys
data.flavorText: DNA from a space virus mutated and became a Pokémon. It appears where auroras are seen.

data.name: Yamask
data.flavorText: The spirit of a person from a bygone age became this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face.

data.name: Pumpkaboo
data.flavorText: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokémon that see it.

data.name: Gourgeist
data.flavorText: In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist will come knocking. Whoever answers the door will be swept off to the afterlife.

data.name: Flittle
data.flavorText: It spends its time running around wastelands. If anyone steals its beloved berries, it will chase them down and exact its revenge.

data.name: Flittle
data.flavorText: It spends its time running around wastelands. If anyone steals its beloved berries, it will chase them down and exact its revenge.

data.name: Espathra
data.flavorText: It emits psychic power from the gaps between its multicolored frills and sprints at speeds greater than 120 mph.

data.name: Tinkatink
data.flavorText: This Pokémon pounds iron scraps together to make a hammer. It will remake the hammer again and again until it's satisfied with the result.

data.name: Tinkatink
data.flavorText: This Pokémon pounds iron scraps together to make a hammer. It will remake the hammer again and again until it's satisfied with the result.

data.name: Tinkatuff
data.flavorText: These Pokémon make their homes in piles of scrap metal. They test the strength of each other's hammers by smashing them together.

data.name: Tinkaton
data.flavorText: The hammer tops 220 pounds, yet it gets swung around easily by Tinkaton as it steals whatever it pleases and carries its plunder back home.

data.name: Scream Tail
data.flavorText: There has been only one reported sighting of this Pokémon. It resembles a mysterious creature depicted in an old expedition journal.

data.name: Gimmighoul
data.flavorText: This Pokémon was born inside a treasure chest about 1,500 years ago. It sucks the life-force out of scoundrels who try to steal the treasure.

data.name: Gimmighoul
data.flavorText: This Pokémon was born inside a treasure chest about 1,500 years ago. It sucks the life-force out of scoundrels who try to steal the treasure.

data.name: Onix
data.flavorText: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.

data.name: Gligar
data.flavorText: It flies straight at its target's face, then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.

data.name: Gliscor
data.flavorText: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

data.name: Groudon
data.flavorText: This legendary Pokémon is said to represent the land. It went to sleep after dueling Kyogre.

data.name: Gible
data.flavorText: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.

data.name: Gabite
data.flavorText: In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales. Medicine containing its scales as an ingredient will make a weary body feel invigorated.

data.name: Mienfoo
data.flavorText: Though small, Mienfoo's temperament is fierce. Any creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly will be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.

data.name: Mienshao
data.flavorText: Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into tiny pieces.

data.name: Minior
data.flavorText: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.

data.name: Nacli
data.flavorText: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.

data.name: Nacli
data.flavorText: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.

data.name: Naclstack
data.flavorText: This Pokémon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the prey's body.

data.name: Garganacl
data.flavorText: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.

data.name: Klawf
data.flavorText: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf can't remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.

data.name: Flamigo
data.flavorText: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.

data.name: Slither Wing
data.flavorText: This mysterious Pokémon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.

data.name: Ting-Lu
data.flavorText: The fear poured into an ancient ritual vessel has clad itself in rocks and dirt to become a Pokémon.

data.name: Zubat
data.flavorText: Zubat live in caves, down where the sun's light won't reach. In the morning, they gather together to keep each other warm as they sleep.

data.name: Golbat
data.flavorText: Its feet are tiny, but this Pokémon walks skillfully. It sneaks up on sleeping prey before sinking in its fangs and slurping up blood.

data.name: Crobat
data.flavorText: This Pokémon flaps its four wings skillfully. Crobat can fly through cramped caves without needing to slow down.

data.name: Absol
data.flavorText: Because of this Pokémon's ability to detect danger, people mistook Absol as a bringer of doom.

data.name: Purrloin
data.flavorText: Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable behavior come away with stinging scratches from its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.

data.name: Liepard
data.flavorText: This stealthy Pokémon sneaks up behind prey without making any sound at all. It competes with Thievul for territory.

data.name: Trubbish
data.flavorText: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.

data.name: Garbodor
data.flavorText: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.

data.name: Yveltal
data.flavorText: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

data.name: Nickit
data.flavorText: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.

data.name: Thievul
data.flavorText: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.

data.name: Morpeko
data.flavorText: Hunger hormones affect its temperament. Until its hunger is appeased, it gets up to all manner of evil deeds.

data.name: Lokix
data.flavorText: When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.

data.name: Brute Bonnet
data.flavorText: It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokémon.

data.name: Steelix
data.flavorText: It is thought its body transformed as a result of iron accumulating internally from swallowing soil.

data.name: Jirachi
data.flavorText: It is said to have the ability to grant any wish for just one week every thousand years.

data.name: Ferroseed
data.flavorText: Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings. Enzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseed's spikes grow big and strong.

data.name: Ferrothorn
data.flavorText: Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes on its feelers into the stone.

data.name: Durant
data.flavorText: With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.

data.name: Honedge
data.flavorText: The blue eye on the sword's handguard is the true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it drains people's lives away.

data.name: Honedge
data.flavorText: The blue eye on the sword's handguard is the true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it drains people's lives away.

data.name: Doublade
data.flavorText: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.

data.name: Doublade
data.flavorText: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.

data.name: Aegislash
data.flavorText: Its potent spectral powers allow it to manipulate others. It once used its powers to force people and Pokémon to build a kingdom to its liking.

data.name: Zacian
data.flavorText: Able to cut down anything with a single strike, it became known as the Fairy King's Sword, and it inspired awe in friend and foe alike.

data.name: Orthworm
data.flavorText: When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.

data.name: Tatsugiri
data.flavorText: Tatsugiri is an extremely cunning Pokémon. It feigns weakness to lure in prey, then orders its partner to attack.

data.name: Porygon
data.flavorText: In recent years, this species has been very helpful in cyberspace. These Pokémon will go around checking to make sure no suspicious data exists.

data.name: Porygon2
data.flavorText: After artificial intelligence was implemented in Porygon2, the Pokémon began using a strange language that only other Porygon2 understand.

data.name: Porygon-Z
data.flavorText: Some say an additional program made this Pokémon evolve, but even academics can't agree on whether Porygon-Z is really an evolution.

data.name: Aipom
data.flavorText: It searches for prey from the tops of trees. When it spots its favorite food, Bounsweet, Aipom gets excited and pounces.

data.name: Ambipom
data.flavorText: It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze, that's proof it really likes you.

data.name: Miltank
data.flavorText: This Pokémon needs to be milked every day, or else it will fall ill. The flavor of Miltank milk changes with the seasons.

data.name: Whismur
data.flavorText: When Whismur cries, the sound of its own voice startles it, making the Pokémon cry even louder. It cries until it's exhausted, then it falls asleep.

data.name: Loudred
data.flavorText: The force of this Pokémon's loud voice isn't just the sound—it's also the wave of air pressure that blows opponents away and damages them.

data.name: Exploud
data.flavorText: This Pokémon can do more than just shout. To communicate with others of its kind, it'll emit all sorts of sounds from the holes in its body.

data.name: Spinda
data.flavorText: Each Spinda's spot pattern is different. With its stumbling movements, it evades opponents' attacks brilliantly!

data.name: Swablu
data.flavorText: It can't relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes off dirt with its wings.

data.name: Tandemaus
data.flavorText: The pair sticks together no matter what. They split any food they find exactly in half and then eat it together.

data.name: Tandemaus
data.flavorText: The pair sticks together no matter what. They split any food they find exactly in half and then eat it together.

data.name: Cyclizar
data.flavorText: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.

data.name: Iron Jugulis
data.flavorText: It's possible that Iron Jugulis, an object described in an old book, may actually be this Pokémon.

data.name: Crustle
data.flavorText: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They're mighty enough to crack Rhyperior's carapace.

data.name: Dottler
data.flavorText: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.

data.name: Toedscruel
data.flavorText: It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.

data.name: Magby
data.flavorText: This Pokémon makes its home near volcanoes. At the end of the day, Magby soaks in magma, resting and recovering from the day's fatigue.

data.name: Iron Moth
data.flavorText: No records exist of this species being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon's traits match up with an object described in an old book.

data.name: Snorunt
data.flavorText: It is said that several Snorunt gather under giant leaves and live together in harmony.

data.name: Mantyke
data.flavorText: It swims along with a school of Remoraid, and they'll all fight together to repel attackers.

data.name: Vanillish
data.flavorText: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterward—it's a kind Pokémon.

data.name: Wimpod
data.flavorText: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy's presence.

data.name: Veluza
data.flavorText: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.

data.name: Blitzle

data.flavorText: Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out static electricity. They're often found sticking to Yamper's hindquarters.

data.name: Gimmighoul
data.flavorText: This Pokémon was born inside a treasure chest about 1,500 years ago. It sucks the life-force out of scoundrels who try to steal the treasure.

data.name: Mienshao
data.flavorText: Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into tiny pieces.

data.name: Minior
data.flavorText: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.

data.flavorText: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.

data.name: Slither Wing
data.flavorText: This mysterious Pokémon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.

data.flavorText: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

data.name: Morpeko

data.name: Brute Bonnet
data.flavorText: It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokémon.

data.name: Ferrothorn

data.name: Aipom

data.name: Swablu
data.flavorText: It can't relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes off dirt with its wings.

data.name: Porygon-Z
data.flavorText: Some say an additional program made this Pokémon evolve, but even academics can't agree on whether Porygon-Z is really an evolution.

data.name: Cyclizar
data.flavorText: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.

data.name: Iron Jugulis
data.flavorText: It's possible that Iron Jugulis, an object described in an old book, may actually be this Pokémon.
